title: Why nemesis draft was a good idea
body:
I like that people can now see just how strong some champions are compared to their pickrate. Some, for example taric, can be devastating in some situations, same as many of the other percieved lower tiered champions. I cant say just how many times ive played with a nautilus who ends up singley winning the game.
Also shows how many people are genuinely confused what champions are good and what are bad, and end up giving team comps that are plaed at even top tiers with womboteamfights adc supports top mid and jungler. Fun mode i find, little bit random, lot of fun.

Tl;dr, people can see the difference between perceived weakness and actual weakness. Grats riot. Now plez urf mode :)

replies.body:
I know. there was a game I was given aatrox...ok, THANKS! 

the fact is none of the champion is "bad", even a support can wreck if built enough AP. If you really want to screw up the other team in champion select, you could try 5 support? Five supports is actually deadly as they an stick together and heal each other all day long, but that requires some levels of teamwork that really doesn't exist in solo Q.  :D

I keep getting Janna or Nami, I'm really not sure why though. Janna with Mejais is pretty strong. I usually just give them Elise because from what I have seen, noone really understands how to play her.

Lol I gave the enemy team victor once (cause, who plays him?) and went mid against him as thresh.

Biggest mistake of my league life, the guy was a victor main

Oh god though. Everyone in the mode seems to think that support champions are trash. But almost all of them have an easy time going somewhere else and doing well. (I myself recently went 36/2 on Lulu adc, which I had never played before, I'm in love)

I own all champions (bar 1) and I'd liek to think i can play pretty much all of them a decent level.
But the reasion I will never play this mode again is the teammates, 3 of the people i played with had only ever played the champs they got once or twice.
I was given anivia which i used to play a fair bit so i did quite well, but one of my teammates had never played elise and went jungle, I saw them repeatedly rappel onto people from point blank.....
It's just too hard to rely on your teammates getting champions that they aren't going to be completely useless on.
It was great ay! I got introduced to Skarner, and I'm in love! Such a great champion.
Good to see "Bring back URF" not attached to %%%%%ing about a gamemode for once :P
